title: Insufficient funds error when running migration script on mainnet
body: - [x] I've asked for help in the [Truffle Gitter](http://gitter.im/Consensys/truffle) before filing this issue. --------------------------- ## Issue When executing a truffle migration script on mainnet, I received Insufficient funds error. There are no errors during the dry run. This issue does not occur on ropsten testnet. ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Use the following network configuration in truffle-config.js ``` infura_mainnet: { networkCheckTimeout: 10000, provider: function() { return new HD_WALLET_PROVIDER(DEPLOYER_MNEMONIC, INFURA_TOKEN, 0, 10); }, network_id: 1 }, ``` 2. Deploy the migration script in this gist (after running the default initial migration script) https://gist.github.com/teikjun/07e9377e8ade1466abbefd1c4dcaeeeb ## Expected Behavior Should execute migration script without error. ## Actual Results Received an error. ``` Error: insufficient funds for gas * price + value at module.exports (/Users/tj/MyProject/migrations/6_deploy_multisig_pauser.js:8:29) at Migration._load (/Users/tj/.nvm/versions/node/v10.24.1/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/migrate/Migration.js:60:1) ``` ## Remarks - I believe that my [deployer account](https://etherscan.io/address/0x276e800BD0EBff3BacaE5c6be7Ff86DFea0518b5) actually has sufficient ether. This is because I am still able to run the initial migration script. Furthermore, just a day ago, I was able to run a larger migration script (which tries to deploy several multisignature contracts instead of one) with less ether. - I am suspecting that there could be issues with my environment, but I am not sure because I've only started using truffle very recently. I have included the dependencies of the project below. I have also tried using a deprecated version of hd-wallet (truffle-hdwallet-provider). Using the deprecated version gives a timeout error instead. Using @truffle/hdwallet-provider gives the error described in this issue. - running `truffle networks` gives the expected output for the migrations contract address. ## Environment * Operating System: MacOS * Ethereum client: Infura (I am using wss instead of https due to the issue described in https://github.com/trufflesuite/truffle/issues/3356#issuecomment-826310780) * Truffle version (`truffle version`): 5.4.1 * node version (`node --version`): 10.24.1 * npm version (`npm --version`): 6.14.12
The problem has been resolved by setting gas to an appropriate amount, so I will close this issue
